Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (46.43%) toCPF-AM1R=L: 20%, K: 16%.Activity: active against S. aureus CMCC 26003 (MIC 4 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa CMCC 10104 (MIC 8 ug/ml), E. coli CMCC 44102 (MIC 4 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae CMCC 46117 (MIC 8 ug/ml), A. baumannii ACCC 11038 (MIC 8 ug/ml), S. dysenteriae CMCC B 51105 (MIC 2 ug/ml), S. paratyphi CMCC 50094 (MIC 2 ug/ml), C-albicans CMCC 98001 (MIC >64 ug/ml).Antimicrobial robustness: NaCl-sensitive:P. aeruginosa (150 mM), KCl-insensitive:P. aeruginosa (5 mM), MgCl2-insensitive:P. aeruginosa (1 mM), FeCl3-insensitive:P. aeruginosa (4 uM);  NaCl-insensitive:A. baumannii (150 mM), KCl-insensitive:A. baumannii (5 mM), MgCl2-insensitive:A. baumannii (1 mM), FeCl3-insensitive:A. baumannii (4 uM).MOA:bacteria:P. aeruginosa:  MOA:bacteria:A. baumannii: membrane permeation (PI).  Appeared to bind A. baumannii genomic DNA at 4xMIC.Structure:  random coil in water and helical in 50% TFE or 50 mM SDS.In vitro toxicity: murine RBC: <5% hemolysis at 8-128 ug/ml.
Literature Information.Author: Zhang MY, Li S, Wang CY, Zhang ZX, Han YL, Liu XQ, Cheng J, Zhou XY, Zhang YX. 2024
Literature Information.Title: A novel antimicrobial peptide S24 combats serious wound infections caused by Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Acinetobacter baumannii.
